Arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the protect configuration.

ProtectConfigurationId.description: The unique identifier for the protect configuration.

CountryCode.description: The two-character code, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format, for the country or region.

ProtectStatus.description: The types of protection that can be used.

CountryRule.description:
Specifies the type of protection to use for a country.

For example, to set Canada as allowed, the `CountryRule` would be formatted as follows:

`{ "CountryCode": "CA", "ProtectStatus": "ALLOW" }`

MMS.description: The set of `CountryRule` s to control which destination countries End User Messaging  can send your MMS messages to.

SMS.description: The set of `CountryRule` s to control which destination countries End User Messaging  can send your SMS messages to.

VOICE.description: The set of `CountryRule` s to control which destination countries End User Messaging  can send your VOICE messages to.

CountryRuleSet.description:
The set of `CountryRules` you specify to control which countries End User Messaging  can send your messages to.

> If you don't specify all available ISO country codes in the `CountryRuleSet` for each number capability, the AWS CloudFormation drift detection feature will detect drift. This is because End User Messaging  always returns all country codes.

description: Create a new protect configuration. By default all country rule sets for each capability are set to `ALLOW` . A protect configurations name is stored as a Tag with the key set to `Name` and value as the name of the protect configuration.

CountryRuleSet.description: The set of `CountryRules` you specify to control which countries End User Messaging  can send your messages to.

DeletionProtectionEnabled.description: The status of deletion protection for the protect configuration. When set to true deletion protection is enabled. By default this is set to false.

Tags.description: An array of key and value pair tags that are associated with the resource.
